title: Planted Steak Wellington
instructions: Sear the planted.steak in a very hot pan with oil for 1 minute per side. Season with salt and pepper. Let cool completely.
Prepare the duxelles: finely chop mushrooms and shallots, sauté in butter until all moisture evaporates and mixture is dry. Season and let cool.
Brush the steak with Dijon mustard. Spread duxelles in a thin layer on plastic wrap, place steak on top, and roll tightly. Refrigerate for 20 minutes.
Roll out puff pastry. Unwrap the steak and place in the center. Fold pastry around the steak, sealing edges with beaten egg.
Score the top decoratively with a sharp knife. Brush entirely with egg wash. Chill for 15 minutes.
Bake at 200°C (400°F) for 25-30 minutes until pastry is deep golden brown.
Rest for 5 minutes before slicing. Serve with a rich red wine jus or peppercorn sauce.
